alert.note: Alert for Albany; Goshen; Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 02 at 8:54AM MST until December 02 at 10:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... Southern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 1000 AM MST. * At 854 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Lakeview North to near Tie Siding, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This snow squall will be near... Wheatland, Chugcreek, Y-O Ranch and Lakeview North around 900 AM MST. Veteran around 930 AM MST. Yoder around 935 AM MST. Huntley around 945 AM MST. Other locations impacted by this snow squall include Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
